meanings.definition: Lack of experience, wisdom, or judgment
meanings.sent1: Her naivety about the dangers of the city led her into trouble.
meanings.sent2: His naivety in financial matters made him an easy target for scams.
meanings.sent3: The young man's naivety in thinking he could get rich quick was endearing.
meanings.sent4: She wore her naivety like a badge of honor, unaware of the risks it brought.
meanings.sent5: The naivety of the child was evident in the way he trusted everyone he met.

meanings.sent1: The naivety of her belief in fairy tales was charming.
meanings.sent2: His naivety shone through in his genuine smile and trusting nature.
meanings.sent3: The naivety of the puppy as it chased its tail brought a smile to everyone's face.
meanings.sent4: In a world of deceit, her naivety was a rare and precious gift.
meanings.sent5: The naivety of the child's question about where babies come from was both amusing and heartwarming.

meanings.sent1: His naivety in believing every email he received led to a lot of trouble.
meanings.sent2: The scam artist preyed on her naivety, tricking her into giving away her savings.
meanings.sent3: The naivety of the tourist in thinking the street vendor was giving a genuine discount was costly.
meanings.sent4: She realized her naivety in trusting strangers too easily when she got scammed.
meanings.sent5: The naivety of the student in thinking he had won a free trip abroad was quickly shattered.
